result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas A Radloff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs to be paid within 90 days. or the Defendant to serve 5 days jail, consecutive, as penalty for non payment.
DNA surcharge waived.
With Huber release for standard conditions.  Credit 1 day.
Defendant to perform 100 hours of community service dealing with respect to woman.  To be monitored by WCS.
The request for expungement is NOT granted by the Court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas A Radloff

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant completed 100 hours of the ordered community service

Defendant Nicholas A Radloff in court with attorney Julius Kim and Attorney Jonathan LaVoy.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The victims mother addresses the court.  Attorney Kim addresses the Court.    The defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count #1:

HUBER:  60 days, w/Standard Release Conditions (Credit - 1 DAY). Defendant to report to Huber facility by 5:00 p.m. on Friday, February 19, 2016.

COURT COSTS: $243.00 (to be paid in 90 days, or defendant to serve 5 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment of costs).

DNA SURCHARGE:  WAIVED BASED ON DATE OF VIOLATION.

COMMUNITY SERVICE: Defendant to perfrom 100 hours of community service dealing with respect to woman.  WCS is to monitor community service.

Defendant is to have no contact with the victim or the victim's family.

EXPUNGEMENT: The request for expungement is not granted by the Court.
From Atty Kim dated 12/11/16 with attached character letters.
Sentencing hearing at 02-17-2016 02:15 pm
Read In List filed by the District Attorney's office
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Nicholas A Radloff in court with attorney Julius Kim and attorney Jonathan Lavoy.   Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty of Count #1 of the amended information.   The two charges on the read in list are dismissed and read in.    Bail remains as set. Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
